Submodules¶

django_utils.admin module¶

django_utils.admin.export_select_fields_csv_action(description=<django.utils.functional.__proxy__ object>, fields=None, exclude=None, header=True)[source]¶

This function returns an export csv action

‘fields’ is a list of tuples denoting the field and label to be exported. Labels make up the header row of the exported file if header=True.

fields=[
(‘field1’, ‘label1’), (‘field2’, ‘label2’), (‘field3’, ‘label3’),

]

‘exclude’ is a flat list of fields to exclude. If ‘exclude’ is passed, ‘fields’ will not be used. Either use ‘fields’ or ‘exclude.’

exclude=[‘field1’, ‘field2’, field3]

‘header’ is whether or not to output the column names as the first row

Based on: http://djangosnippets.org/snippets/2020/

django_utils.managers module¶

class django_utils.managers.StatusManager[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.manager.Manager

This adds a query methods to pull records based on status.

draft()[source]¶

This adds a query method to pull all draft records.

published()[source]¶

This adds a query method to pull all published records that are not expired.

published_or_hidden()[source]¶

This adds a query method to pull all published or hidden records that are not expired

An abstract model for ordering via an integer.

class django_utils.models.StatusModel(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This abstract model has the same properties as the Common Model, but it allows for statuses to be applied to the object.

class Meta[source]¶
abstract = False¶

StatusModel.is_draft()[source]¶

Returns True if object is draft

StatusModel.is_hidden()[source]¶

Returns True if object is hidden

StatusModel.is_published()[source]¶

Returns True if the object is published, and False otherwise.

StatusModel.is_published_or_hidden()[source]¶

Returns True if the object is published or hidden, and False otherwise.

StatusModel.objects¶
class django_utils.models.TimeStampedModel(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This is an abstract model which will be inherited by nearly all models. When the object is created it will get a created_at timestamp and each time it is modified it will receive a updated_at time stamp as well.

class Meta[source]¶
abstract = False¶

django_utils.settings module¶

django_utils.shortcuts module¶

django_utils.shortcuts.get_status_list_or_404(model, **kwargs)[source]¶

Attempts to get a list of objects in the given model with the given kwargs, but also checks if they’re published. This will raise a 404 error if the list is empty.

django_utils.shortcuts.get_status_object_or_404(model, **kwargs)[source]¶

Checks for an object in the given model with the given kwargs, but also checks if it’s published. This will raise a 404 if the object does not exist.

django_utils.shortcuts.render_response(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Render a response with the given context
